isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - HEATER AND AIR CONDITIONER - OPERATION - Heater-Cab With Pro Sleeper

svcproc.title: Heater-Cab With Pro Sleeper
svcproc.para: Power is supplied to (B2) battery stud, circuits 14H, 14Z, fuse F1-C and circuit 75A to the heater control relay (463-R5). When the key switch (40) is moved to the ignition position, power flows in through circuits 13H and 13AK to the coil of heater control relay (463-R5). The ground path for the heater control relay is circuits 13-GT, 77-G, 58-GA and 11-G to right dash panel ground stud. This energizes the heater control relay (463-R5) and allows power to flow through the N.O. contacts and circuit 75B to fan control switch (11).

When the heater-A/C blower switch (11) is moved to the low position, power flows through the switch, circuit 75C, connector (162), circuit 75C, resistor/thermofuse (27), circuit 75T, connector (161), circuit 75T, high speed relay (462-R2) N.C. contacts, circuit 75F, connector (161) and circuit 75F to blower motor. This causes the blower motor to run at low speed. The blower motor ground path is through circuit 75-G, connector (161), circuits 75-G and 11-G to the right dash panel ground stud.

When the heater-A/C blower switch (11) is moved to the medium position, power will flow through the switch as in the low speed setting and power will also flow through the switch and circuit 75N to the medium speed relay (462-R3). This energizes the medium speed relay (462-R3) and allows power to flow through heater control relay (463-R5) N.O. contacts, circuit 75D, medium speed relay (462-R3) N.O. contacts, circuit 75M, connector (161), circuit 75M, resistor/thermofuse (27), circuit 75T, connector (161), circuit 75T, high speed relay (462-R2) N.C. contacts, circuit 75F, connector (161), and circuit 75F to the blower motor. This causes the blower motor to run at medium speed. The blower motor ground path is through circuit 75-G, connector (161), circuits 75-G and 11-G to right dash panel ground stud. The ground path for the medium speed relay (462-R3) is circuit 75-GC, 50-GB and 11-G to right dash panel ground stud.

When the heater-A/C blower switch (11) is moved to the high position, power will flow through the switch as in the medium speed setting, and power will flow through the switch and circuit 75H to the high speed relay (462-R2). This energizes the high speed relay (462-R2) which is grounded through circuits 75-GB, 75-GC, 50-GB and 11-G to the right dash panel ground stud.This allows power to flow from (B2) battery stud through circuits 14H, 14X, fuse F1-A, circuit 75, high speed relay (462-R2) N.O. contacts, circuit 75F, connector (161), and circuit 75F to the blower motor. This causes the blower to run at high speed. The blower motor ground path is through circuit 75-G, connector (161), circuits 75-G and 11-G to right dash panel ground stud.

When the blower switch (11) is in the low, medium or high position, power is supplied by the switch to circuit 77 and the air conditioner switch (904). When switch (904) is moved to the on position, power flows through its indicator light and ground circuits 77-GK and 11-GB to left cab ground (429). This causes the indicator to illuminate. Power also flows from switch (904) through the blocking diode, circuits 77S and 77K to the A/C control relay (144), thus energizing the relay that is grounded through circuits 77-GS, 82-GA, 12-GF, 11-GQ and 11-GF to left dash panel ground stud.
